hook.text: A surgery with a 90% survival rate sounds great. One with a 10% death rate sounds terrifying. Same surgery.

buildup.text: Framing is how the way information is presented changes the decisions people make.

discovery.text: Credit card companies frame interest as a small 'daily rate' â€” 0.05% sounds harmless. That's 20% per year.

twist.text: Reframing your own finances changes behavior. '$5 a day' vs '$1,825 a year' hit differently.

climax.text: Financial literacy is partly about reframing: seeing through how information is packaged to influence you.

punchline.text: How you see the number changes the decision.

quiz.question: What is a framing effect?
options: How presentation changes decisions about identical information
